text: When the computer froze, it didn't respond anymore.
When the musician wrote the song, it was wonderfully composed.
When the baby bird penned his first novel he was just a fledgling author.
s_p: any new participant in some activity
s_a: young bird that has just fledged or become capable of flying
explanation: A fledgling is another word for young bird. Fledgling can also be used to describe a person that is new or without experience. The author is new or without experience. This is a play on the word "fledgling".

text: When the swimmer entered the pool, it was evident she was passionate.
When the artist started drawing, the work was flawless.
When the chef added extra spice, things got a little intense.
When the scientist found the formula, it was a groundbreaking discovery.
When the photographer captured the sunrise, the moment was perfectly captured.
When the gardener saw the blooms, it was clear they were flourishing.
When the astronaut noticed gravity, everything moved quickly downward.
When the runner saw the track, he thought it was a joke.
When the athlete wore the shoes, his performance was greatly improved.
When the tailor adjusted the coat, it was the best possible fit.
When the King asked the fool for a joke the fool just shrugged. He was the court gesture.
s_p: motion of hands or body to emphasize or help to express a thought or feeling; the use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
s_a: a professional clown employed to entertain a king or nobleman in the Middle Ages
explanation: This is a pun on 'court jester' which was a fool or joker was a member of the household of a nobleman or a monarch employed to entertain guests during the medieval and Renaissance eras, but 'gesture' is used in it's place because it sounds similar and because 'gestures' is a form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication in which visible bodily actions communicate particular messages, in this case shrugging

text: When the editor saw the manuscript, she knew the changes were just about write.
s_p: to make marks that represent letters, words, or numbers on a surface, such as paper or a computer screen

text: When the artist mixed blue and yellow, it was a moment of ingenuity.
When the hiker reached the summit, it was the highlight of his journey.
When the TV repairman got married the reception was excellent.
s_p: a formal party of people; as after a wedding
s_a: quality or fidelity of a received broadcast
explanation: Reception has different meanings. Reception can mean ceremony. So, in this case, reception means wedding ceremony. Reception can refer to the receiving of broadcast signals. A television needs to receive broadcast signals in order to work. The joke is centered on the word "reception" and its different meanings.

text: When the clock struck midnight, it was notable.
I learned that the antelopes were coming when I heard the gnus
s_p: large African antelope having a head with horns like an ox and a long tufted tail
s_a: informal information of any kind that is not previously known to someone; information about recent and important events
explanation: "Gnus" sounds like "news". Gnus are a type of African antelope. News is noteworthy information that is broadcast. The joke is a play on the word "gnus" which sounds like "news".

text: When the human cannonball was late for work he got fired.
s_p: terminate the employment of; discharge from an office or position
explanation: To be fired at a job means the employer terminates employment against the will of the worker. Showing up late for work multiple times can be enough to get fired. To fire a cannon means to set it off. The use of the word "fire" is used in two ways here.

text: When the bee started interacting, they found it to be fascinating.
When the lady cut hair, she did it shear genius.
s_p: to remove (fleece or hair) by cutting or clipping
s_a: completely such, without qualification or exception

text: When the hairdresser cut hair, she did it with great skill.
When the shocked IRS agent was found guilty of tax evasion he had to take time to collect himself
s_p: call for and obtain payment of
explanation: This is a pun on the word "collect". To collect oneself means to calm down after an emotional event. The word Collect can refer to when you gather up something, like when the IRS gathers up people's tax money. It's kind of ironic for the IRS agent, whose job it is to collect tax money, to evade taxes himself.

text: When the writer picked the pen, creativity flowed onto the paper.
When the poet forgot his lines, he found himself in trouble.
When the singer sang the ballad, it was perfectly executed.
When the doctor made the diagnosis, it was reassuring to know.
When the thief fell in the wet cement and broke both legs, he became a hardened criminal.
s_p: converted to solid form (as concrete)
explanation: This is a pun on 'hardened' which in this context means having become or been made hard or harder, like what would eventually happen if you fell into wet cement. But 'hardened' can also mean experienced in a particular job or activity and therefore not easily upset by its more unpleasant aspects, like those criminals who have spent a lifetime devoted to crime

text: When the tailor measured the fabric, it was precisely done.
When the doctor asked the editor how he was doing, he said he had a problem with his circulation.
s_p: the dissemination of copies of periodicals (as newspapers or magazines)
s_a: movement through a circuit; especially the movement of blood through the heart and blood vessels
explanation: This is a pun on 'circulation' which in the context of a doctor means the continuous motion by which the blood travels through all parts of the body under the action of the heart. But it's also being used because 'circulation' can also mean the number of copies sold of a newspaper or magazine, which is what an editor might be concerned with

text: When the prankster performed the trick, everyone was momentarily fooled.
When the singer hit the high note, it captivated the entire audience.
When the director called action, the scene was truly impressive.
When the historian uncovered the truth, it was a significant revelation.
When the architect saw the blueprint, the design was well-maintained.
When they bought a water bed, the couple started to drift apart.
s_p: lose personal contact over time
s_a: be in motion due to some air or water current
explanation: The joke is play on the phrase 'drift apart'.  When used in describing a relationship, 'drift apart' generally means that the love between the people is fading.  They have a water bed, and in water one could drift away from somebody else just by a current or force in the water, or simply laying in the water and drifting.

text: When the chef made a meal, it was truly extraordinary.
When the technician fixed the computer, the outcome was remarkable.
When the tailor altered the pants, the outcome was seamless.
s_p: without any seams (i.e. the lines of sewing joining different pieces of cloth)

text: When the janitor wanted to take up public speaking he always had the floor.
s_p: the inside lower horizontal surface (as of a room, hallway, tent, or other structure)
s_a: the parliamentary right to address an assembly
explanation: The joke is a play on the phrase 'have the floor.' Typically that phrase is used to say that a person speaking has the stage or platform to speak on.  The janitor cleans the floors, and so they would always 'have the floor'.

text: When the proposal was made to locate the governor's mansion in Albany, New Yorkers said, 'That's a capitol idea'
s_p: a building occupied by a state legislature
explanation: This is a play on words. A "capital idea" is a really good idea but a state "capitol" is a building where the state government's legislative body meets. Here, the idea to locate the mansion in Albany is a "capitol" idea because it's regarding the location of the state's capitol building.

text: When the magician performed the trick, it was simply impressive.
When the mathematician worked the problem, he solved it methodically.
When the mountaineer reached the peak, the view was incredibly elevated.
When told his design for a stadium was too grandiose, the architect shed a tier.
s_p: one of two or more layers one atop another
s_a: a drop of the clear salty saline solution secreted by the lacrimal glands
explanation: This is a pun on the word "tier". The word "tear" has been replaced by the similar-sounding word "tier" because "tier" can refer to the way rows of seats are stacked up in a stadium and this joke is about a stadium. Alternatively, "tier" can refer to the relative level of something, as in "high tier". "High tier" is another way of saying "grandiose", and in the joke the architect's design is described as "grandiose".

text: When the ship set sail, the voyage was full of potential.
When the engineer examined the bridge, everything was stable.
When the chef seasoned the soup, it was full of flavor.
When I went to the International Club, I accidentally spilled coffee on a Hindu lady's dress. I told her I was very sari.
s_p: a dress worn primarily by Hindu women; consists of several yards of light material that is draped around the body
s_a: feeling or expressing regret or sorrow or a sense of loss over something done or undone
explanation: A sari is a type of dress. Hindus are often seen wearing them Sari sounds like "sorry". The person is apologizing for spilling coffee on the person's sari.

text: When the surfer caught a wave, it was great.
When the astronomer located the comet, it was such a big achievement.
When the architect built the house, it was a remarkable success.
When the farmer planted the seeds, he harvested what he planted later.
When the artist tried to draw a cube he had a mental block.
s_p: an inability to remember or think of something you normally can do; often caused by emotional tension
s_a: a three-dimensional shape with six square or rectangular sides
explanation: A cube can be considered a block. A block is a solid piece of hard material, typically with flat surfaces on each side. A mental block is an inability to think through or recall something. The word block is being used in different ways here.

text: When the guitar student failed the symphony exam, she knew she had to face the music
s_p: to accept criticism or punishment for something you have done
s_a: to handle the art or study of music

text: When the conductor led the symphony, it was excellently performed.
When the programmer wrote the code, the logic was based on experience.
When the pilot landed, it was straightforward and simple.
When the philosopher thought deeply, he experienced an intellectual journey.
When the soloist started the concert, it was an unusual opening.
When the engineer tested the prototype, the design required adjustments.
When the gardener saw the plants, he began a new approach.
When the weatherman predicted rain, there was some optimism about the clouds.
When the captain steered the ship, it was an easy maneuver.
When the child saw the snow, the delight was snow joke
s_p: to be like snow, which is the small, soft, white pieces of ice that sometimes fall from the sky when it is cold
s_a: to be not any; not one; not a

text: When the chef garnished the dish, it was the finishing touch.
When the airplane was mid-flight, the passengers were quiet and sleepy.
When the gardener pruned the bushes, the garden thrived.
When the baker left, he let the bread rise.
When the pilot landed, he did it plane and simple.
s_p: an airplane or hydroplane

text: When the astronomer watched the stars, he found the experience impressive.
When the human cannonball retired they couldn't find a replacement of the right caliber.
s_p: a degree or grade of excellence or worth
s_a: diameter of a tube or gun barrel
explanation: The joke is a pun. A human cannonball is a person who performs an act in a circus or similar show by getting fired out of a cannon. Finding someone of 'the right caliber' means finding someone who has the proper quality or level of ability. 'Caliber' also means the internal diameter or bore of a gun barrel.

text: When asked to picture the perfect modern defensive weapon the Claymore springs to mine.
s_p: explosive device that explodes on contact; designed to destroy vehicles or ships or to kill or maim personnel
explanation: This is a play on words. To "spring to mind" means an idea has occurred to someone. However, "mind" sounds like "mine" which is a defensive weapon and one type of mine is the Claymore mine.

text: When the florist arranged the bouquet, it was stunningly beautiful.
The waiter was shocked when I asked for my salad to be served naked. I explained, no dressing please.
s_p: savory dressings for salads; basically of two kinds: either the thin French or vinaigrette type or the creamy mayonnaise type
s_a: the activity of getting dressed; putting on clothes
explanation: In the joke, the speaker is referring to dressing, the topping put on a salad, by making it sound like dressing, to put clothes on

text: When the makeup artist applied the cosmetics, the transformation was remarkable.
When the server brought the meal, it was very satisfying.
When the storyteller shared the tale, it was captivating throughout.
When the detective found the clue, it was essential for solving the mystery.
When the comedian delivered the punchline, it was perfect.
When the scientist discovered the molecule, things became more engaging.
When the computer freeze, it can't byte back.
s_p: unit of data equal to eight bits; computer memory is often expressed in megabytes or gigabytes
s_a: to grip, cut into, or injure something with or as if with the teeth; do harm

text: When the teacher gave the lesson, it involved significant learning.
When the detective cracked the case, he found it to be simple.
When the tailor altered the pants, the outcome was flawless.
When the novelist finished the book, it was a significant accomplishment.
When the editor saw the manuscript, the changes were necessary.
When the boat sailed, the ocean was very welcoming.
When the gardener found a new hobby, he started to enjoy it.
When the mechanic repaired the engine, it ran smoothly.
When the comedian delivered the joke, it was extremely entertaining.
When the music teacher broke the music stand, she accepted the consequences.
When the musician played, the song was beautifully harmonious.
When the dancer took the stage, her moves were completely captivating.
When the butter melted, it was rendered useless.
s_p: cause to become
s_a: melt (fat or lard) in order to separate out impurities
explanation: Butter that melts is also rendered fat or butter. Something rendered useless is deemed not usable.

text: When the cat noticed the mouse attack, it was bound to end in hissteria.
s_p: to say something in a quiet angry way
s_a: extreme fear, excitement, anger, etc. that cannot be controlled

text: When the bartender stirred the cocktail, it was of excellent quality.
When the climber scaled the mountain, the view from the top was incredible.
Cows make noise only when they're in the mood.
s_p: a characteristic (habitual or relatively temporary) state of feeling
s_a: the sound made by a cow or bull; make a low noise, characteristic of bovines
explanation: The sound a cow makes is "moo". The word "moo" can be found in "mood". When someone or something is "in the mood" it means they feel like doing something. This joke is playing on the word "mood" because it has "moo" in it which references the sound a cow makes.

text: When the artist painted the ocean, she knew it would cause impact.
When the plums dry on your tree, it's time to prune.
s_p: dried plum
s_a: cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
explanation: This is a pay on words. The word "prune" refers to the horticultural practice of pruning, or removing certain parts of a plant. However, a "prune" is also a type of dried plum.

text: When the teacher faced a puzzle, she found it had all the correct elements.
When the librarian shelved the books, it was an innovative idea.
When the lawyer met a mime, he was at a loss for words.
When the philosopher read a paradox, it required deeper thought.
When the musician lost tempo, he found his rhythm was disrupted.
When the orchestra tuned their instruments, the harmony was flawless.
When the child saw the snow, the delight was palpable.
When the lights went out, the electrician was surprised.
When the clown entered the room, everyone started laughing.
When the teacher marked the exams, she was very meticulous.
When the librarian found the book, she was occupied for the day.
When the cat saw the mouse, it was bound to end in chaos.
When the writer crafted a sentence, it was excellently done.
When the shoe store owner discovered that someone had broken into his store, the police pumped him for information.
s_p: a low-cut shoe without fastenings
explanation: A pump is a type of shoe with a medium heel. To pump someone for information means to aggressively get information from someone. This joke is about a shoe store break in, and centers on the different meanings of the word "pump".

text: When the historian uncovered the document, it was extremely interesting.
When the scientist presented the findings, it was very enlightening.
When the baker crafted the wedding cake, each layer was beautifully executed.
When the air conditioning failed in the indoor stadium there was a fan protest.
s_p: a device for creating a current of air by movement of a surface or surfaces
explanation: The joke is a pun.  'Fan' is another word for someone who follows and frequents shows, a performer, or a sporting team.  'Fan' could also mean an air conditioning device.

text: When the organizer saw the mess, she sorted it quickly.
When the sculptor finished the statue, it was marble-ous.
s_p: a type of very hard rock that has a pattern of lines going through it, feels cold, and can be polished and sculpted

text: When the pirate captain's ship ran aground he couldn't fathom why.
s_p: measure the depth of (a body of water) with a sounding line; a linear unit of measurement (equal to 6 feet) for water depth
explanation: The joke is a pun. A fathom is a unit of length equal to six feet (approximately 1.8 m), chiefly used in reference to the depth of water. One could also use the word 'fathom' to mean 'understand', so the pirate could not understand why they ran aground, but there may not have been enough fathoms for the ship to sail through.

text: When the tailor argued, he had his own evidence.
When the sculptor finished the statue, it turned out to be exceptional.
When the mechanic fixed the car, things were aligned perfectly.
When the penguin went back to the Arctic, he felt so embarrassed the he decided to leave.
When the astronaut noticed gravity, things went down quickly.
s_p: to lose or go badly
s_a: to move down to a lower level or place

text: How could I trust the ceiling fan installer when I knew he was always screwing up.
s_p: make a mess of, destroy or ruin
explanation: A screw is a metal object similar to a nail, except it has a raised spiral line around it. Installing a ceiling fan requires use of screws. A screw helps fasten pieces together. The screws for the ceiling fan would need to be screwed upwards in order to install it. The installer is "screwing up" the fan, or installing the fan into the ceiling. "Screwing up" is a saying which means messing up. This joke is playing on the word "screwing up" and its different meanings.

text: When the explorer found the map, it was essential for the journey.
When the athlete crossed the finish line, it was an unforgettable event.
When the engineer saw the plan, he made sure everything proceeded correctly.
When the chemist mixed the elements, they combined well.
When the baker kneaded dough, he always worked extra hours.
s_p: worked the dough by hand

text: When the old gardener seasons the meat, he always say it's thyme well spent.
s_p: an herb used in cooking

text: When the chef served the soup, it became a brothtaking experience.
s_p: relating to broth, the base of soup

text: When the musician played his solo, the performance was truly note-worthy.
s_p: related to a note, a musical sound of a particular pitch

text: When the computer crashed, it lost its drive in a fatal error.
s_p: a computer's storage device

text: When the poor painter started brushing, he had a stroke of bad luck and died.
s_p: a mark made by a brush
s_a: a sudden change in the blood supply to a part of the brain, sometimes causing serious damage

text: When the mathematician solved the problem, they commented that the solution was integral to the discussion.
s_p: related to the process of integration in mathematics

text: When the tailor sewed the suit, he claimed it was a cut above the rest.
s_p: to slice or trim fabric
s_a: being superior or of higher quality

text: When the carpenter hammered the nail, it was a striking example of hard work.
s_p: the act of hitting forcefully

text: When the pilot took off, he said the view was plane amazing.
s_p: relating to an airplane

text: When the astronaut returned, he said his journey was truly out of this world.
s_p: the planet Earth or its inhabitants

text: When the footballer scored, the team secured a net gain over the opponents.
s_p: the area surrounded by a piece of material made from string into which a ball or puck is put in order to score points in various sports

text: When the man asked the woman why she was angry, she replied - 'It's just a period'.
s_p: an interval of time

text: When the barber cut hair, every snip was shear brilliance.
s_p: to cut (especially wool or hair)

text: When the chef flipped the omelette, he proved his skills were eggstraordinary!
s_p: remarkably good with an egg

text: When the farmer looked down at the field, he knew he was beeten.
s_p: relating to beets, the vegetable

text: When the astronaut landed the spaceship, he had not yet understood the gravity of the situation.
s_p: the physical force that pulls objects toward Earth

text: When the fisherman cast his net, he declared it was reel genius.
s_p: a device used in fishing

text: When the pianist performed, she definitely struck a chord.
s_p: a group of simultaneous musical notes

text: When the scientist observed the experiment, even the smallest change sparked a big reaction.
s_p: a response in a chemical process

text: When the leaders gathered in the aftermath of war, they sought to rebuild the nation peace by peace!
s_p: freedom from war and violence

text: When the cyclist pedaled, his energy was wheelie impressive.
s_p: a maneuver in cycling involving a lifted front wheel

text: When the pastry chef baked, the restaurant was clearly on a roll.
s_p: a small, rounded piece of bread

text: When the bartender mixed the cocktail, he stirred up a spirited pun.
s_p: containing alcohol (spirits)

text: When the writer penned his story, every word delivered a novel twist.
s_p: referring to a fictional book

text: When the pilot asked the teacher about her son, she replied that the kid had a bad altitude.
s_p: referring to height (as in flight)

text: When the carriage was destroyed, the wheels started a revolution.
s_p: uprising
s_a: one complete circular movement of something

text: When the brewer fermented the beer, he joked it was a hoppy accident.
s_p: relating to hops used in brewing

text: When the mathematicians do drugs, they easily experience addition.
s_p: the process of adding numbers or amounts together
s_a: an inability to stop doing or using something, especially something harmful

text: When the tailor sewed the dress, he remarked it was sew impressive.
s_p: to stitch or mend fabric

text: When the electrician lit the bulb, the idea was brilliantly current.
s_p: the flow of electricity

text: When the chef sauted the vegetables, he claimed the dish had a real zest for life.
s_p: the outer peel of citrus used for flavor

text: When the farmer plowed the field, he made a groundbreaking discovery.
s_p: physically breaking the ground in farming

text: When the baker measured the flour, he joked it was the yeast he could do.
s_p: a fungus used in baking

text: When the dancer performed, her moves were toetally amusing.
s_p: referring to toes in a playful twist

text: When the gardener pruned the hedge, he claimed it was a cut above the rest.
s_p: the act of trimming or pruning

text: When the runner laced his shoes, he claimed it was a tie to his fast pace.
s_p: a piece of neckwear used here to imply a connection

text: When the retired nurse dug deep, he struck a vein of gold.
s_p: a mineral-filled fissure in rock
s_a: a channel in the body where blood flows

text: When the mechanic replaced the tire, he claimed it was a wheelie good fix.
s_p: a cycling maneuver involving a lifted front wheel

text: When the virus learns to tell jokes, we'll have a pundemic.
s_p: a widespread outbreak of puns

text: When the musician played, he said his performance was truly key.
s_p: a set of musical pitches

text: When the architect reviewed the design, he said the plans really raised the roof.
s_p: to physically elevate or build

text: When the electrician wired the room, he remarked that his work was quite illuminating.
s_p: emitting light

text: When the teacher discussed the upcoming grammar test, she noticed that the students felt tense.
s_p: a grammatical category indicating time

text: When the chemist tested the solution, he remarked this was a basic requirement.
s_p: chemically alkaline

text: When the farmer harvested the crop, he declared the yield amaizeing.
s_p: pertaining to maize (corn)

text: When the fisherman watches a TV series, he is hooked after two episodes
s_p: caught by a hook (fishing)

text: When the sailor navigated the waters, he claimed he could sea no obstacles.
s_p: a large body of salt water

text: When the farmer visited the market, he declared that the corn was ear-resistible.
s_p: referring to an ear of corn

text: When the chef prepared the stew, he announced that dinner was cumin together.
s_p: a spice used in cooking

text: When the carpenter examined the blueprint on the wall, he realized that he had nailed it.
s_p: secured with nails to something

text: When the geologist examined the sample, he declared the formation was gneiss.
s_p: a type of metamorphic rock

text: When the driver suddenly stopped the car, he did it because it was time for a brake.
s_p: a device for slowing or stopping a vehicle

text: When the botanist saw the bear in the forest, he decided it was time to leaf.
s_p: the foliage of a tree
s_a: to go away from someone or something

text: When the rooster started stalking the cat it was quite the scene. Talk about a real cocktail
s_p: a drink, usually an alcoholic one, made by mixing two or more drinks together
s_a: following another person to discover where that person goes

text: When the mathematician completed his proof, he remarked that the demonstration was as easy as pi.
s_p: the mathematical constant (3.14159...)

text: When the audio engineer calibrated the speakers, he insisted that the performance was sound.

text: When the editor reviewed the manuscript, he remarked that every chapter was novel in its approach.
s_p: a work of fiction

text: When the cat won the lottery, it said, 'I was feline lucky today!'
s_p: belonging to the family Felidae, which includes the lions, tigers and cats

text: When the grape got stepped on, it let out a little wine!
s_p: an alcoholic drink that is usually made from grapes

text: When the gardener heard her favourite music, she quickly yelled 'Please, turnip up!'
s_p: a type of root vegetable
s_a: to increase the volume of something

text: When the sailor came back home, he was in a sinking mood
s_p: to cause a boat or ship to go down to the bottom of the sea

text: When the God of Sin saw the damage on his boat, he sighed and thought - 'I guess I am really Sin King now
s_p: the King of Sin
s_a: to cause a boat or ship to go down to the bottom of the sea

text: When the park ranger fell into the river, he had to really fight for deer life
s_p: a quite large animal with four legs that live in forests

text: When the lawyer spoke, she knew how to appeal to the crowd. Her arguments were always compelling
s_p: to make a formal request in court
